page.title: 18WEST END FARM (2)
page.content: Technological improvements have brought about changes in modern farming.A task such as ploughing is no longer restricted to daylight hours.Powerful lights and comfortable cabs enable the drivers to work late into the night in both autumn and spring preparing the fields for their crops.Crops are sprayed against disease by light plane or helicopter.Mr Baker built a large reservoir, with a capacity of 7 million gallons,just below the farm in 1977. This was done to enable the potato crop to be irrigated at the right time in order to swell the tubers and to combat periods of drought.Mr Baker feels that the crop fits in well with the system of crop rotation he employs on his farm.The potatoes are harvested by machine,stored in large sheds and bagged during the winter before being sold to local distributors.
